intro: Ophiorrhiza liukiuensis, commonly known as the Liuqiu mistflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub native to the Ryukyu Islands, including Taiwan, Japan, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
